job_title: Data and Use-Case Analyst – SupTech Solutions
job_description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  Data and Use-Case Analyst – SupTech SolutionsLocation: EuropeDuration: Short- to medium-termEstimated Workload: Short-term assignments / task-based consultancyAbout the Opportunity: We are creating a pool of Data and Use-Case Analysts – SupTech Solutions for a new FWC Contract: EC-SG REFORM/2025/OP/0001: Provision of consultancy services to support the design, development, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of structural reforms in EU Member State. Experts in this pool will be contacted for specific assignments as they arise. If you have relevant experience we encourage you to apply.Key Responsibilities:      Work with NCAs to define, document, and deploy a selected number of SupTech use cases.Provide analytics support to monitor case performance and feasibility.Advise on data collection standards and feedback loops for solution refinement.Support the development of technical documentation and case evaluation reports.
Qualifications:      Degree in data science, public sector analytics, or fintech.5+ years in data-driven regulatory solutions, use-case validation, or supervisory analytics.Familiarity with dashboarding, data visualisation, and SupTech/RegTech ecosystems.Experience with cross-border data harmonisation is a plus.

        Since 2007, we have delivered sustainable development projects and provided advisory services within engineering, policy, economics, and social fields.With more than 1.200 implemented long- and short-term projects completed, and 17 project offices around the world, we have established ourselves as a leading consulting company. Through our development projects, we have developed a true interdisciplinary approach, and our services cover several core sectors, through which individual projects are consistently tackled in transparent and innovative approaches.We believe that the success of every project lies in adopting a participatory approach to all project processes and ensuring that the outcomes of the projects are the result of a joint effort with national and local institutions and the communities involved.NTU is committed to providing high quality services to clients under the highest standards of corporate ethics and competitive practices, and with total integrity in its transactions. NTU acts at all times for the benefit of clients, and carries out services with professional integrity, while not jeopardising the interests of society.NTU acts with loyalty to its clients, and maintains the confidentiality of any information from the client that is obtained in the process of performing its services. NTU also keeps confidential the documents and reports prepared for a client.NTU always avoids conflicts of interest, and informs a client beforehand of any potential conflict of interest that could emerge during the execution of consulting services.NTU does not accept any remuneration that could encourage the firm to offer a biased opinion. NTU avoids any political contributions.NTU Quality & Business Integrity Management: www.ntu.eu/who-we-are/quality-and-business-integrityNTU International is an ISO 9001:2015 Certified CompanyNTU International is rated AAA by Bisnode

job_description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  Job DescriptionThe incumbent provides technical leadership and project management for the development of end to end innovative analytic and reporting web applications, used across the global biostatistics & programming (B&P) user community. Reporting to the Global Head of Analytics and Reporting Tools (ART), and with the support of senior ART team members located across the world, the incumbent leads development, maintenance, and release of R packages and RShiny applications in production with quality and in a timely manner, following regulatory requirements. The incumbent applies hands-on technical expertise in R and Shiny, combined with clinical trial, statistical analysis, APIs, devops tools, Docker/Kubernetes, and cloud environment knowledge to succeed in the development and deployment of innovative statistical reporting solutions. The incumbent serves as a department level expert to interact with IT and support companywide initiatives that have impact on technology related processes, as well as a mentor and train junior level team members and internal resources.Responsibilities      Work with ART team members, Statistical programmers and Statistician on the development, maintenance, and support of innovative R packages and Shiny applications to support Statistical Analysis on global clinical trial projects.Collaborate with IT, standard governance, and Quality Assurance for the deployment in production of global innovative reporting applications on premise or in the cloud.Ensure proper documentation, validations and ensure support is in place for each application following our SOP and regulatory requirements.Train / Mentor junior ART team members on R package and Shiny application developmentEnsure training material and user guide are available for each application.Provide technical guidance to project teams and users on all matters involving ART applications and tools as needed.Support department initiatives and task forces. Lead/participate in departmental or cross-functional working groups and process improvement activities.Identify areas for improvement and recommend solutions related to systems, reporting tools, technologies, and best programming practices.Actively participate in department working groups, provide input in development of tools applicable to process improvement.
Qualifications      Advanced degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Life Science, or related field, with +5 years of web application development experienceExcellent technical skills with programming languages such as R, Python, Java, typically used for software development in a global environment.Strong knowledge in frontend development: Shiny, JavaScript, Vue.js, Jinja.Demonstrated experience and strength in developing, maintaining, and deploying web applications and APIsDemonstrated experience with DevOps tools such as GitHub, GitLab, Jira, Confluence, CI/CD.Proven experience with relational and non-relational database such as MySQL, Postgres, MongoDB. Extra points for Graph DatabasesGood Knowledge of CDISC standards.Good understanding of regulatory requirements concerning electronic submission.Strong understanding of pharmaceutical clinical development (i.e., understanding of statistical concepts, techniques, and clinical trial principles).Collaborative teamwork and interpersonal skills that demonstrate initiative and motivation. Strong problem-solving skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills in a global environment.
#CYTELINTAbout UsCytel is the largest provider of statistical software and advanced analytics for clinical trial design and execution. For over thirty years, Cytel’s scientific rigor and operational excellence have helped biotech and pharmaceutical companies navigate uncertainty, prove value and unlock the full potential of their data.Come be a part of a team where talent, experience and scientific rigor come together to advance the state of clinical development. As the industry's largest provider of statistical software and advanced analytics, Cytel is home to some of the most innovative, collaborative and rigorous biostatistics, statistical programming and data management talent. Cytel careers offer meaningful work and stimulating challenges within a welcoming and diverse global culture.Whether your specialty is biostatistics, statistical programming, adaptive clinical trial design, clinical data management, Bayesian statistics, real-world evidence, artificial intelligence, health economics, or a corporate function, you will be growing an exciting career while contributing to advancing the future of human health at Cytel. Search our open jobs or get in touch today to find your fit!

        Cytel is the world’s leading data-science CRO, driving advancements in human health through robust analytics and innovative clinical trial software. For nearly four decades, we have set the standard in adaptive trial design, leveraging extensive data insights to inform strategy throughout every phase of drug development and commercialization. Our mission is clear: accelerate drug development, enhance success rates, and deliver better patient outcomes. With a comprehensive suite of services from innovative trial design to end-to-end biometrics and real-world evidence, our specialized, multidisciplinary team ensures optimal strategies for preclinical research, trial execution, market access, and reimbursement. Headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, Cytel has a global presence with over 2,000 employees across North America, Europe, and Asia. Learn more about how Cytel is harnessing the power of data to advance human health at www.cytel.com.

job_description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  Field Service Engineer Ben jij een techneut die houdt van vrijheid, verantwoordelijkheid én afwisseling? Werk je graag hands-on bij de klant, maar vind je het ook leuk om je kennis te delen, installateurs te trainen en mee te denken over betere serviceprocessen? Dan is deze functie als Field Service Engineer bij VAMAT jouw volgende stap.Je komt te werken in een kleine organisatie met topkwaliteit producten, waar je directe impact hebt op klanttevredenheid én technische innovatie. Of het nu gaat om klanten helpen op locatie, het inbedrijfstellen van een opslagsysteem of het geven van een workshop aan collega’s en klanten – jij maakt het verschil.Waarom deze functie bij VAMAT?      Technische afwisseling: Van opslagsystemen in bedrijf stellen tot trainingen geven en input leveren voor projectontwerpen;Je ziet direct resultaat van wat je doet – jouw inzet zorgt voor werkende installaties en tevreden klanten;Werken met producten van een topmerk;Je bent een essentieel onderdeel van het service team. Je werkt met fijne collega’s en in een organisatie waar je ideeën er echt toe doen.
Wat ga je doen?Als er ondersteuning op locatie nodig is kom jij in actie en analyseer je knelpunten. Als Field Service Engineer ben jij dan ook hét gezicht van VAMAT op locatie. Je bent onderdeel van de Service afdeling en je werkt nauw samen met de Service Desk. Als het nodig is schakel je met onze internationale partner: Huawei. Met elkaar komen jullie tot oplossingen.Je werkt met producten van een topmerk in een uitdagende en veelzijdige functie in een internationaal georiënteerde organisatie. Je kunt je breed oriënteren en ontwikkelen in bijvoorbeeld het design van PV-systemen en projecten.Jouw verantwoordelijkheden:      Je helpt klanten op locatie met technische vragen en storingen;Je stelt opslagsystemen (batterijen) en PV-installaties in bedrijf;Je schakelt met collega’s van de Service Desk én met onze servicepartners (zoals Huawei);Je traint installateurs bij klanten en deelt je kennis in workshops;Ook intern deel je je kennis via trainingen en workshops. En je geeft input voor onze kennisbank;Het sales team geef je technische input voor bijvoorbeeld een projectontwerp.
Wat breng jij mee?Je bent iemand die gestructureerd, georganiseerd en veilig werkt. Je bent een natuurlijke probleemoplosser met een passie voor techniek. En je bent continu op zoek naar manieren om jezelf en je kennis te verbeteren. Hiermee draag je ook bij aan het succes van het team. Dit is een zelfstandige functie, waarin je dagelijks met verschillende collega’s schakelt. Daarnaast heb je een klantgerichte mindset en goede communicatieve vaardigheden (zowel mondeling als schriftelijk) in het Nederlands en Engels.En verder heb je:      werkervaring als Field Service Engineer, Service Monteur buitendienst of Technisch Specialist of vergelijkbare functie;kennis op, minimaal mbo-niveau, van elektrotechniek, mechatronica of energietechniek;inzicht in PV-systemen of energieopslag is een pré (of je staat ervoor open dit snel te leren);affiniteit met IT. Ervaring in de PV/solar branche is een pre;rijbewijs B.
Wat bieden we jou?Bij VAMAT krijg je niet alleen een veelzijdige baan van 40 uur per week, maar ook de kans om jezelf te ontwikkelen. In ons gezellige team gaan hard werken hand in hand met veel plezier in een informele sfeer. Je krijgt training voor alle Huawei specifieke apparatuur.En verder:      een marktconform salaris, afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring;bonus van maximaal 1 maand salaris afhankelijk van de EBITDA van VAMAT;een auto, laptop, telefoon, gereedschap en apparatuur van de zaak;28 vakantiedagen en 8% vakantiegeld;goede pensioenregeling waarbij VAMAT 2/3 van de premie betaald.
Over VAMATOok als werkgever willen wij een positief verschil maken. Voor onze medewerkers, voor jou en voor een duurzame wereld. Het succes van ons bedrijf hangt samen met de passie en inzet van onze medewerkers. Samen zorgen wij voor een positieve, open, ambitieuze en pragmatische bedrijfscultuur waarin iedereen zich thuis voelt en zijn of haar capaciteiten optimaal kan benutten. Ondernemerschap, persoonlijke ontwikkeling en doorgroei krijgen bij ons dan ook volop de ruimte.VAMAT is de gecertificeerde Value Added Partner van Huawei voor PV omvormers, transformatoren en batterijopslag in de Benelux en is verantwoordelijk voor de verkoop en distributie aan groothandels en grote bouwers van zonne-systemen. Huawei is met haar solar producten in korte tijd wereldmarktleider geworden.Klaar voor jouw volgende technische uitdaging?Solliciteer nu direct en ontdek hoe jij als Field Service Engineer het verschil maakt – technisch, inhoudelijk en persoonlijk. Heb je vragen of wil je eerst kennismaken? Neem contact op met Irene Keur (recruiter a.i.) via 06-53452305 of irene@vamat.nl. We kijken ernaar uit om je te leren kennen.

job_description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  Als Software tester ben jij altijd op zoek naar meer. En bij ons is er genoeg om naar op zoek te gaan! Heb jij ervaring als software tester en werk je graag met de nieuwste technologieën op het gebied van software? Dan ben je bij ons op het goede adres.Wat ga je doen?Als Software tester lever je een bijdrage aan ontwikkeling, oplevering en het bewaken van de kwaliteit van de software voor integrale logistieke oplossingen van Inther Group. Verder ben je verantwoordelijk voor:      Het opstellen van testplannen aan de hand van een functionele specificatie;Het maken en onderhouden van automatische testen;Het testen van opgeleverde (deel)software. User interface, maar met name achtergrondprocessen;Inhouse alsook onsite testen bij de klant;Het continue bewaken van de kwaliteit en gebruiksvriendelijkheid van de software;Het geven van input voor het verbeteren van ons softwareproduct;Het rapporteren van testresultaten aan de Software Engineers.
Wat vragen wij van jou?Als Software Tester heb jij een analytisch en probleemoplossend vermogen en heb je een goed oog voor detail. . Jij kunt je goed focussen en stopt pas als je je doel behaald hebt. Jij bent secuur in je werk en communicatief sterk.Verder breng je onderstaande met je mee:      HBO werk- en denkniveau;Ervaring met het testen van software is een pré;Kennis van Java, SQL en test automation is een pré;Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift;Reisbereidheid naar onze (inter)nationale klanten.
Wat bieden wij jou?Als Software tester verdien je, afhankelijk van jouw kennis en ervaring, tussen de € 2.650,- en € 4.700,- bruto per maand.Verder bieden wij jou:      Veel vrijheid voor het invullen van jouw eigen rol;30 vakantiedagen waarvan 3 collectieve sluitingsdagen (deze worden jaarlijks vastgelegd);Opleidingsmogelijkheden binnen jouw vakgebied, afhankelijk van waar jij jezelf op wil ontwikkelen;Een pensioenregeling bij Nationale Nederlanden;Een vitaliteitsbudget van € 140,- netto per jaar te gebruiken voor jouw sport abonnement of sport benodigdheden;Iedere dag verse lunch met broodjes en snacks tegen een kleine eigen bijdrage;Wekelijkse borrels aan onze eigen bar, Inther-feesten en de leukste teamactiviteiten!
TeamOnze Software afdeling werkt met de laatste technieken op et gebied van softwareontwikkeling en is altijd op zoek naar een nog efficiëntere en betere manier van werken, waarbij we graag jouw ondersteuning en kennis inzetten! Je rapporteert als Software Tester rechtstreeks aan Sanne, onze teamlead tester, welke jou tevens optimaal zal coachen. Al zin om onderdeel van team Software te worden?! Solliciteer dan direct via onderstaande button!

job_description:
About the job
Madison Square Garden Sports Corp. (MSG Sports) is a leading professional sports company, with a collection of assets that includes the New York Knicks (NBA) and the New York Rangers (NHL), as well as two development league teams – the Westchester Knicks (NBAGL) and the Hartford Wolf Pack (AHL). MSG Sports also operates a professional sports team performance center – the MSG Training Center in Greenburgh, NY. More information is available at www.msgsports.com.

Who are we hiring? 

The Knicks’ Basketball Products Software Engineer will develop tools, web applications, and data infrastructure. The role will partner with departments within Basketball Operations (e.g., Scouting, Strategy) to identify, design, and implement products to drive insights and support decision making. Candidates with previous full-stack development experience—particularly in building web applications using REST services and JavaScript frameworks—are preferred, though recent graduates with strong foundational skills are also encouraged to apply.

What will you do? 

Design and implement tools and web-based applications for basketball operations.
Collaborate with team members through the entire software development lifecycle.
Interface with basketball operations departments to build visualizations, tools, and reporting capabilities to meet their needs.
Follow best practices and established patterns of software development and design.
Support ingestion and transformation of data from multiple external and internal data sources.
Enjoy being a generalist working on both the front-end, backend, and doing anything it takes to solve problems and deliver what users need.

What do you need to succeed? 

Bachelor’s degree or accredited certificate in computer science or related field.
Software development experience with the following technologies:
Front-end JavaScript frameworks (e.g. React [Next.js], Vue, Angular)
CSS/Web Styling frameworks (e.g. Material, Bootstrap)
Back-end frameworks (e.g. Express, .NET, Django)
Relation databases (e.g. SQL Server, MySQL)
Knowledge of the software development lifecycle and industry best practices.
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills – must be able to breakdown complex tasks and craft an execution strategy with little guidance.
Fundamental understanding of NBA contracts and front-office processes.
Pay Range

$100,000—$125,000 USD

At MSG, we recognize the importance of upskilling employees’ talents and strengths so they can drive their careers forward. We are proud to offer a robust set of tools and resources to help employees understand their interests and purpose, harness their talents and obtain the skills they need to reach the next step in their careers. Growth and longevity for our employees are top priorities here.

We value diversity and are looking for extraordinary employees of all backgrounds! MSG is an Equal Opportunity Employer and provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, sexual and reproductive health choices, national origin, citizenship, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. In addition to federal law mandates, MSG complies with all applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in all locations and will consider requests for reasonable accommodations as required.

company_info:
About the company
Madison Square Garden Sports Corp.
27,196 followers
Follow
Spectator Sports 1,001-5,000 employees 442 on LinkedIn
MSG Sports features some of the most recognized teams in professional sports, including the New York Knicks (NBA) and the New York Rangers (NHL). As an original franchise of the NBA, the Knicks have a rich history that includes eight trips to the NBA Finals and two NBA Championships. The Rangers hockey club is one of the “Original Six” franchises of the NHL. With four Stanley Cup Championships and 11 Stanley Cup Final appearances, the Rangers remain one of the league’s marquee teams. Both teams play their home games in New York’s Madison Square Garden – The World’s Most Famous Arena.

Other MSG Sports properties include two development league teams – the Westchester Knicks, which serve as the exclusive G-League affiliate of the Knicks, and the Hartford Wolf Pack, the player development team for the Rangers playing in the American Hockey League (AHL).

The Company also has an established presence in the emerging world of esports through Knicks Gaming, an NBA 2K League franchise. As one of the inaugural teams in the NBA 2K League, Knicks Gaming won the first-ever League Championship title in 2018.

In addition to its teams, MSG Sports operates a state-of-the-art performance center. The Madison Square Garden Training Center in Greenburgh, NY is a 16-acre facility that offers the Knicks, Rangers and Westchester Knicks a specialized training environment, with dedicated equipment for each team, the latest sports technology to optimize performance and first-class amenities.

job_description:
About the job
Quant Developer – HFT Platform (Rust) 

Venture Search has partnered with a leading global cutting-edge crypto trading firm, that are looking for a talented Quant Developer to join their newly formed quantitative trading team, playing a key role in building and scaling their next-generation high-frequency trading (HFT) platform, developed in Rust.

This is a rare opportunity to work alongside an industry-renowned HFT expert and contribute directly to the design and development of trading systems that will shape the future of our clients firm. You’ll collaborate on a wide range of initiatives spanning algorithm development, system optimization, and integration with decentralized finance (DeFi) protocols.

Key Responsibilities

Develop Trading Algorithms: Design and refine low-latency, high-frequency trading strategies.
Build Front-Office Trading Systems: Contribute to the development of core systems for data processing, risk management, live trading, and post-trade analysis.
Integrate with DeFi Protocols: Onboard and process real-time data feeds from decentralized platforms.
Backtest Strategies: Conduct historical analysis to evaluate and optimize trading models.
Implement Risk Controls: Develop robust risk management features, including capital limits and stop-loss mechanisms.
System Monitoring and Debugging: Maintain real-time trading systems and resolve operational issues efficiently.

Qualifications

Strong programming capabilities with a focus on low-level development and performance optimization
Minimum 2 years of experience developing HFT or trading systems
Deep understanding of trading infrastructure, including order books and order state machines
Proficiency in Rust, or significant experience in C/C++ with exposure to Rust (Note: all technical assessments and tasks will be conducted in Rust)
Knowledge of crypto markets is a plus

Preferred Skills & Attributes

Curious, self-directed, and proactive
Results-oriented with a strong sense of ownership
Excellent mathematical and analytical thinking
Able to manage multiple priorities in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
Fluent in English (professional working proficiency)

job_description:
About the job
Technical Sales Specialist Medical Plastics 
Homebased Netherlands 

Job ref: EG/63841


Client Overview:
Petrochemical manufacture, specialising in the production of polypropylene, polyethylene and polyolefin products, for use in a wide range of applications, such as automotive parts, healthcare, electrical appliances, textiles, packaging materials and numerous household items. They focus on long-term partnerships, working together closely with their clients to create tailor-made products. 
The business is manufacturing polypropylene for life science applications and medical markets, combining technological know-how with a constant drive for innovation, 


Role Overview
The Technical Sales Specialist Medical, supports the further development and commercialisation of medical polypropylene grades, within the Healthcare & Medical industry. 
The incumbent is responsible for driving innovation, collaboration and technical development and ensuring the highest standards of product performance and quality of medical materials.
The focus is on selling technical products or solutions, providing technical support, and enhancing customer satisfaction through high-quality, specialized service. 
The Technical Sales Specialist operates from a strong background in polymer science, particularly polypropylene, and a deep understanding of medical product development and regulatory requirements.

Responsibilities:

Technical Sales & Product Development: 
Offer technical solutions and support to customers by translating customer needs into product improvements and innovations.
Assessing the feasibility (technical, raw material costs, regulations) of new medical polypropylene grades and products.
Lead the development from concept through to commercialization, ensuring they meet regulatory standards. 
Support customers in implementing technical products and services 
 Developing product specification

Technical Support & Training: 
Provide expert technical support and training to customers and internal teams during implementation and maintenance phase.
Provide in-person assistance with product qualification at customer level
Provide in-depth product-technical support to internal stakeholders in analyzing customer complaints. 
Develop and deliver training programs for customers and internal teams, on the application and benefits of medical polypropylene products.
Preparing product information documents (e.g., technical datasheets, brochure content, etc.)



Market Intelligence & Innovation / Product development:
Driving innovation by keeping up with the latest trends and technologies in the application of medical polypropylene grades.
Support product development through technical expertise and together with the Sales & Business Development Manager, develop opportunities for our range of medical products

Quality Assurance:

Oversee quality assurance processes to ensure products meet stringent medical standards and regulatory requirements.

Person Specification:
Bachelors degree in material science, polymer engineering, chemical engineering, biomedical engineering or biotechnology 
Experience gained in a customer facing role 
Medical Device Regulations (e.g., FDA regulations, ISO standards like ISO 13485).


To apply please contact Ellie Guest
Ellie.guest@listgrove.com
0044 (0) 1789 207070

CONNECT WITH ME ON LINKEDIN.

job_description:
About the job
About Us
We are an innovative tech company building scalable products that solve real-world problems. Our engineering team values clean architecture, continuous improvement, and collaboration. We're looking for a talented Full Stack Engineer who can build robust, performant, and scalable applications from frontend to backend.
Responsibilities
Design, develop, and maintain end-to-end web applications using modern frontend and backend technologies.
Collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and other engineers to define, build, test, and deliver features.
Write clean, maintainable code and perform code reviews.
Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability.
Integrate third-party APIs and services.
Maintain best practices in software engineering, testing, and DevOps.
Participate in architectural discussions and help shape product direction.
Requirements
3+ years of professional experience as a Full Stack Developer.
Strong proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript and at least one modern frontend framework such as React, Vue, or Angular.
Solid backend experience using Python or Java.
Strong understanding of RESTful APIs, GraphQL, and microservices architecture.
Experience with databases like PostgreSQL, MySQL, or MongoDB.
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, Docker, Git, and cloud platforms like AWS, GCP, or Azure.
Experience with testing frameworks such as Jest, Mocha, or Cypress.
Strong communication skills and the ability to work in a remote or distributed team.
Nice to Have
Experience with serverless architecture.
Knowledge of DevOps best practices.
Exposure to machine learning or AI-based APIs.
Experience with mobile development using React Native or Flutter.
Benefits
Competitive salary.
Remote-first culture with flexible working hours.
Learning and development stipend.
Paid vacation and sick days.
Health insurance, where applicable.

job_title: [Full remote - EMEA] Junior Software Engineer - Android
job_description:
About the job
This position is within Revolut, a leading fintech company.

Joinrs AI summary of the opportunity: Revolut seeks a full-time Android Software Engineer graduate for their Rev-celerator Programme. Candidates should have a degree in computer science or related fields and excellent communication skills. You will collaborate on feature design and prototyping, ensuring app consistency. Revolut offers visa assistance, travel costs, and initial accommodation for international candidates relocating to tech hubs. 

The selection process will be fully managed by Revolut.
--

About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 55+ million customers get more from their money every day.
As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.


About the role

Our Technology team isn’t just one of the best in the industry. It’s one of the best in the world. And we’re proud of it. It’s our driving force, our engine. From building a new financial backend to creating an innovative app that millions of people around the world will use, there’s nothing (and we mean nothing) our tech team can’t do.


About the Rev-Celerator Graduate programme ?
Are you a recent graduate eager to shape the future of finance? Ready to make a meaningful impact and bring innovative ideas to life? Well, the Rev-celerator Graduate Software Engineer programme is designed just for you.
First, kick off with a few weeks of bootcamp, where we’ll prepare you to jump into work at Revolut with workshops, lectures, and practical exercises to start developing your skills. After successful preparation, we’ll launch you into on-the-job training where you’ll be face-to-face with tough challenges, problem-solving, and tasks to own.
We’re looking for Software Engineers who are interested in every step, stage, and release of a feature. Want to work alone? This isn’t for you. We want communicators. One minute you’re chatting to a Product Owner, the next a Designer, and then a customer (for feature feedback, we don’t need you on the phones).
Like your projects varied? This is for you. We don’t pigeonhole. We want you to spread your wings to as many places as possible.


Join us from anywhere ✈️
The Rev-celerator Graduate Programme is now open to international candidates from around the world, willing to relocate to one of our tech hubs in the UK, UAE, Poland, Portugal, or Spain. We’ll support you every step of the way - from visa assistance (if needed) to travel costs and the first month of accommodation. We’re here to make your move as smooth as possible. Please check further details with your assigned recruiter, as conditions may apply.

Up for the challenge? Let's get in touch ?


What you'll be doing

Collaborating closely with product designers with a focus on new feature design and prototyping
Playing a key role in the user experience design process, from wireframes and mockups, through to implementation and release
Working closely with designers and businesses to define and implement elegant solutions to interesting problems
Helping define and maintain visual guidelines, and ensure consistency throughout the app
Prototyping new user interactions based on feedback from your peers
Gaining exposure to the Android SDK


What you'll need

A portfolio of multiple coding side projects or open source contributions
To have graduated university in 2024, 2025, or 2026
A 2:1 predicted or achieved grade (or above)
University studies in computer science, maths, physics, or a similar field
A proactive attitude
Love for problem-solving
Fluency in English
To be a quick learner with an ambitious and results-driven personality
Excellent communication and organisational skills
To feel comfortable working as part of a diverse team in a fast-paced environment
Full-time availability for the programme starting in September 2026

job_description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  “Ben jij gepassioneerd over technologie en wil je bijdragen aan innovatieve zorgproducten die écht verschil maken? Solliciteer dan bij Mentech voor de functie van Backend Developer!”Over MentechWij transformeren de zorg met innovatieve technologie en geloven dat innovatie essentieel is om hoge kwaliteit zorg voor kwetsbare mensen te borgen op de lange termijn.Mensen met een verstandelijke beperking of dementie kunnen hun emoties, pijn of ongemak niet goed uiten, wat leidt tot onbegrip en onnodige stress. Dit maakt het voor zorgprofessionals moeilijk om de juiste zorg te bieden. Wij ontwikkelen technologie die het makkelijker maakt voor zorgverleners om écht in te spelen op de behoeften van deze kwetsbare mensen. Onze producten en services verbeteren de kwaliteit van leven van deze mensen, en verlagen de druk op de zorg.We ontwikkelen Hume (emotieherkenningsplatform op basis van sensoren, gedragsmodellen en machine learning), Noa (conversational interface die nabijheid en support biedt) en voeren ontwikkelprojecten uit voor zorg gerelateerde klanten op aanvraag.FunctiebeschrijvingAls Back-end Software Engineer bij Mentech speel je een belangrijke rol in het ontwikkelen van nieuwe functies voor onze producten. Je ervaring met Java en cloudgebaseerde systemen, zoals AWS, helpt ons betrouwbare en efficiënte platforms te bouwen. In deze functie werk je nauw samen met een team van professionals om technische uitdagingen om te zetten in praktische oplossingen.Wat ga je doen?      Ontwikkelen en verbeteren van de Java back-end van onze productsystemen, met focus op prestaties, schaalbaarheid en veiligheid.Actief deelnemen aan alle fasen van de applicatielevenscyclus, met nadruk op codering, debuggen en integratie.Samenwerken met front-end ontwikkelaars, datawetenschappers en zorgprofessionals om naadloze oplossingen te leveren die echt een verschil maken.Cloudgebaseerde technologieën, specifiek AWS, gebruiken om oplossingen effectief te implementeren en te beheren.Bijdragen aan codebeoordelingen, continue integratie, testen en deploymentprocessen om hoge kwaliteits- en efficiëntienormen te handhaven.
Wat zoeken we in jou?Must-have      Een bachelor- of masterdiploma in Software Engineering, Informatica of een gerelateerd veld.Ten minste 2 jaar aantoonbare ervaring in back-end ontwikkeling, bij voorkeur in Java.Bekwaamheid in cloudservices, vooral AWS, en ervaring in het implementeren en beheren van cloudgebaseerde oplossingen.Ervaring in het ontwikkelen van REST API’s en werken met relationele databases in enterprise software.Bekendheid met containerisatietools zoals Docker.Ervaring met Git, CI/CD-pijplijnen en agile ontwikkelmethodologieën.Geïnteresseerd in het medische domein, in het bijzonder in projecten gerelateerd aan gezondheidstechnologie of zorg.
Nice-to-have      Ervaring met Websockets voor het ontwikkelen van API’s.Kennis van infrastructuur als code (Terraform, Serverless)Kennis van niet-relationele databases en hun toepassing in schaalbare projecten.Bekendheid met MQTT of andere berichtenprotocollen geschikt voor realtime communicatie.Begrip van edge computing concepten en ervaring in het ontwikkelen van oplossingen voor edge-apparaten.Ervaring met andere back-end talen zoals GoBeheersing van de Nederlandse taal.
Waarom Mentech?Bij Mentech krijg je de kans om technologie en gezondheidszorg te combineren en echt een verschil te maken. We werken aan innovatieve projecten die de levens van mensen met verstandelijke beperkingen of dementie verbeteren. Jouw persoonlijke en professionele groei is voor ons belangrijk. Bij Mentech krijg je de ruimte om bij te dragen aan deze impactvolle projecten, met goede arbeidsvoorwaarden en ruimte voor ontwikkeling.Wat We Bieden      Werken in een dynamische en snelgroeiende omgeving binnen een scale-up.Bijdragen aan innovatieve producten die een echte impact maken in de zorg.Een cultuur die samenwerking, diversiteit en slimme, empathische oplossingen waardeert.Een competitief salaris, hybride werkopties, uitstekende voorwaarden en ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden.
Ben jij gepassioneerd over technologie en wil je samen met ons een verschil maken? Heb je de vaardigheden die we zoeken? We horen graag van je en kijken ernaar uit om samen te werken aan innovatieve oplossingen!Solliciteer nu!

job_title: Engineer Modeling & Validation of Wind Turbine Simulation Models
company_name: Fraunhofer Institute for Wind Energy Systems (IWES)
job_description:
Develop validation methods for offshore wind turbines, researching suitable methods.
Implement validation methods in Python.
Evaluate added value and usability of methods on test benches.
Model and simulate offshore wind turbines.
Further development of existing MoWiT models.
Responsible for setup (incl. design basis and design load cases) and evaluation of MoWiT simulations.
Independently generate synthetic simulation data and compare with measurement data.
Document findings and results in academic publications.
Present results at conferences and specialist trade fairs.
Assist in project acquisitions by doing research.
Requirements:
Completed diploma or master’s degree with a focus on wind energy.
Experience in wind turbine simulation, modeling, and programming (in Modelica, Python, or C).
Knowledge of offshore wind turbines (especially in hydrodynamics and wave theories) is a plus.
Knowledge of verification and validation methods, ideally in offshore wind energy, is advantageous but not required.
Good command of German and English.
job_insights: Wind turbine simulation, Modeling, Programming (Modelica, Python, C), German, English, Validation methods

apply_info.salary_info: Appointment, remuneration and social security benefits based on the public-sector collective wage agreement (TVöD). Performance-based variable remuneration components.

job_description: We are looking for a skilled software engineer with Python experience...
